title: microforest
text:
Introduction
microforest is a repository for Sylvain Schmitt’s analyses from the MicroForest project, which studies the adaptation of forest trees by examining genetic diversity and natural selection in regenerating seedlings. Microforest’s objective is to compare contrasting management methods for each species.

title: microforest
text:
Project
microforest includes all codes to access the data (in data/) & analyse the data (files.qmd) with associated documentation and figures. Intermediary files and outputs can be accessed in outputs/. The project takes advantage of renv to manage the R environment for enhanced reproducibility.

title: Data
text:
Spatial data
Data from ONF (Caroline Bedeau caroline.bedeau@onf.fr pers. com.) and ECOFOG (Théo Maugard theo.maugard@inrae.fr pers. com.)


Code
ggplot(manare) +
  geom_sf(size = .01, alpha = .2, col = "lightgrey") +
  geom_sf(data = carbet, aes(col = "carbet")) +
  geom_sf(data = roads, alpha = .4) +
  geom_sf(data = tracks, alpha = .2) +
  geom_sf(data = lidar_prev, fill = NA,
          aes(col = "LIDAR 2023")) +
  geom_sf(data = lidar_fut, fill = NA,
          aes(col = "LIDAR scheduled")) +
  geom_sf(data = corners, aes(col = treatment)) +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_discrete("")







Code
ggplot(manare %>% st_crop(st_bbox(corners))) +
  geom_sf(size = .01, alpha = .2, col = "lightgrey") +
  geom_sf(data = roads %>% st_crop(st_bbox(corners)), alpha = .4) +
  geom_sf(data = tracks %>% st_crop(st_bbox(corners)), alpha = .2) +
  geom_sf(data = corners, aes(col = treatment)) +
  geom_sf(data = lidar_prev %>% st_crop(st_bbox(corners)), fill = NA,
          aes(col = "LIDAR 2023")) +
  geom_sf(data = lidar_fut, fill = NA,
          aes(col = "LIDAR scheduled")) +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_discrete("")
